collection_holder_name: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, Dorothy and Lewis B. Cullman Center
pageContext.collection_description: Address to American Legion, Chicago, Oct. 2, 1933. - FDR in Miami, Feb. 15, 1933: Makes an impromptu speech while driving in open car; Attempted assassination by Zangara [noise of shots, shouts of crowd; from a radio broadcast long after event, or from an aural biography?]; Mrs. F. W. Cross describes assissination attempt and how she deflected the aim of the gunman.
